sentence: Im ambivalent about mongolian literature. it has its prose and khans.
explanation: In this context, khans refers to rulers in Mongolian history or literature.
first_new_sentence: The khans led the Mongol Empire with great authority.
second_new_sentence: The khans organized the tribes and established a structure for governance.

sentence: I care about how girls feel. the firmer the better.
explanation: Firmer refers to the consistency or density of a physical object.
first_new_sentence: The firmer the material, the more support it provides.
second_new_sentence: She prefers a firmer handshake because it conveys confidence.

sentence: On the internet you can be whoever you want. its odd that so many choose to be stupid.
explanation: Odd refers to something that is unusual or different.
first_new_sentence: It is an odd situation when two friends argue over trivial matters.
second_new_sentence: The odd behavior of the cat kept the family entertained.

sentence: Why did the foot smile? he was toe very happy.
explanation: Toe refers to the digits of the foot.
first_new_sentence: She stubbed her toe and winced in pain.
second_new_sentence: The athlete took great care of his toe to avoid injuries during the game.
